lines.text: [repeated line]
Who, me?
You know it means the rope, Butch, if they catch you? Who's in on it?
Well, me and Olsen and Joe and the Hawk.
The Hawk? That means blood.
No, he promised me he wouldn't bump nobody off.
Why, he croaked his own mother.
Sure he did. He cut her throat. He was sorry for it. He's all right.

[Looking at a picture of Kent's sister]
Gee... it reminds me of Sadie. Gee, Sadie was a good skirt. I shouldn't have slipped her that ant poison. I should have just battered her in the jaw a few times.
What's your name?

[after getting no response]
I said what's your name?
Kent Marlowe.
Mine's Schmidt. I'm known the world over as "Machine Gun Butch." You heard of me, naturally.

[after Kent shakes his head 'no.']
Never heard of the Delancey Gang bein' wiped out? Well, I done the wipin'.

[to Kent]
And remember, this prison does not give a man a yellow streak, but if he has one, it brings it out.
If you don't open the gates and let 'em out, they're gonna kill all the guards beginning with Wallace.
I'll see 'em in Hell first. Let 'em have it!

[to Morgan]
Say, listen. Don't let the guys know you've gone straight. They used to have a lot of respect for you.
Kent Marlowe. Manslaughter. Sentenced to 10 years. First time in prison?
Yes.
Sir, to me!
Yes sir.
How old are you?
Twenty-four, sir.
Ever serve in the Army? Navy? Marine Corps?
No sir.
Use tobacco?
Yes sir.
Morphine? Opium? Cocaine?
No sir.
Frisk him.
If you're ever around here again, drop in.
Oh, you don't mean that.
Why, of course I do.
Gee, you're a peach of a girl.
How's all the dames outside? See my initials carved on many bed posts?
What happens when you get through the inner gate?
We crash that outer gate and there's a car waitin' outside.
When does it come off?
Thanksgiving day. Noon. Most of the screws go to turkey dinner. We'll give 'em a belly full.
